p: We identified 29,349 SNPs from which 3,454 loci remained after filtering for quality, depth, HWE, LD, and F ST outlier loci. We detected four genetic clusters ( K = 4) using two different clustering approaches (Figure 2, Supporting Information Figure S1), and excluded four samples from subsequent analyses (final sample size was 156 individuals) because they were likely introduced bees from a distant location (Supporting Information Figure S2, Table S1). Cluster assignments were generally unambiguous as ancestry coefficients for the assigned clusters were usually above 0.50 (lower 25% quantile = 0.50, median = 0.60, upper 75% quantile = 0.86). Clusters 1 and 4, located at the northern and southern extremes of the species distribution range, showed the lowest N e and π. All genetic clusters showed small but significant inbreeding and values of Tajima's D overlapping zero (Table 1).
